title: Poster, De Nieuwe, An Exhibition of Recent Graphic Design, 1987
title_raw: De Nieuwe, An Exhibition of Recent Graphic Design
inscribed: Recto: imprinted in black, vetically, upper left: AGA; in black inside yellow rectangle American Institute of Graphic Arts; and gray inside black box: San Francisco  Chapter; imprinted in white inside black segment box for half of text and rest in white or black, upper left edge (vertically): januari 21- februari 6/ 1987; in black, upper right corner: logo, circle with: the / N; vertically near right edge: Co-sponsored by California College of Arts and Crafts; lower right corner: This exhibition is the first comprehensive review of Dutch design.  Material for this exhibition has been curated by Doug Kisor,/ Director of Design, Art Department, Eastern/ Michigan University./ Exhibited work is from the collection of Katherine McCoy, Co-chairman, Design Depart-/ ment Cranbrook Academy of Art; in black inside segemented yellow box: Open Presentation by Katherine McCoy./ January 20, 1987/ 6:30 pm/ California College of Arts and Crafts/ 1700 17th street at de Haro/ San Francisco; below: CCAC Students with valid ID: Free/...Non-chapter members: $15; lower center: Exhibition runs from January 21 to February 6, 1987 at the/ Contract Cetner/ 650 7th Street at Townsend/ San Francisco/ 9:00 to 5:00 Closed Sat and Sun. Verso: in black, upper right corner (inversed): Printing  Canon Press / Photon Press / Paper International Paper Company / Springhill bond / offset 28/70, white / Springhill band/offset 28/70, gray / Typography On Line Typography/ Design Lucille Tenazas Design
description: To promote exhibition on recent Dutch graphic design.  Recto: Collage of images from exhibition and text.  Partial old print of Amsterdam in yellow toned wood frame labeled "RIJKS-MUSEUM TE AMSTERDAM" along bottom of frame.  Another black and white left corner of ornate frame outlines the left corner of this print.  Four yellow diagonal lines of unequal length with 1, 2, 3, 4 labeled in black.  Yellow outline square overlaps print of Amsterdam.  Dotted square divided into four equal sections inside. Dutch stamp worth 70C part of exhibition reproduced and placed over left side of square.  DE in black and NIEUWE in gray, intersects at I which is inside circle at top right. At upper right corner, imprinted in black: an exhibition of recent graphic [horizontally], design from / the Netherlands [vertically], POSTERS TO POSTAGE STAMP [in curve], linking horizontal and vertical text.  Four skinny vertical rectangles along right edge, evenly spaced.  Verso: 1, 2, 3, 4 in gray forming diagonal at lower center and imprinted: an exhibition of recent graphic [horizontally], design from / the Netherlands [vertically] in black.  Imprinted in black rectangle in gray font:  AIGA San Francisco Chapter; in black: American Institute of / Graphic Arts / 212 Sutter Street / San Francisco / California 94108.  Two skinny black and three skinny yellow rectangles along right edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, De Nieuwe, An Exhibition of Recent Graphic Design, 1987. Offset lithography on gray paper. 
Gift of Lucille Tenazas. 1995-171-1
